meanings.definition: The state or quality of being uncultivated or unused.
meanings.sent1: The fallowness of the field showed it had not been planted for a long time.
meanings.sent2: The fallowness of the land made it clear that no crops had been grown there recently.
meanings.sent3: The fallowness of the garden made the weeds feel like they were in charge.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a fallowness waiting for new ideas to take root.
meanings.sent5: The fallowness of the desert stretched endlessly, untouched by human hands.

meanings.definition: The state of being inactive or unproductive.
meanings.sent1: The fallowness of the factory led to a decrease in production.
meanings.sent2: His fallowness at work was noticed by his boss, who encouraged him to be more productive.
meanings.sent3: The fallowness of the computer screen made him realize he had been staring at it for hours without doing any work.
meanings.sent4: The fallowness of the market reflected the slow economy in the region.
meanings.sent5: The fallowness of his creativity was broken when he started painting again.
